newsitem.title: USA: Eltrax completes acquisition of Hi-Tech.
newsitem.headline: Eltrax completes acquisition of Hi-Tech.

text.p: Eltrax Systems Inc said Monday that it has completed the acquisition of Hi-Tech Connections Inc, an enterprise network solutions company based in Reading, Pa., for undisclosed terms.
Eltrax said it expects the all stock transaction to be accounted for as a purchase.

The Hi-Tech acquisition had been announced in March of this year, but Eltrax and Hi-Tech suspended discussions in April. Eltrax said when talks with Hi-Tech recently resumed, the structure of the deal was changed from a straight stock transaction to a "selling shareholder earn-out" formula.

Under this arrangement, an Eltrax spokesman said the deal calls for a certain certain amount of Eltrax shares paid to Hi-Tech shareholders and a second amount of shares based on Hi-Tech's earnings for a six-month period.

Hi-Tech has offices in Reading, Herndon, Va., and Iselin, N.J. The company markets enterprise network systems and services to customers in Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Virginia, Maryland, and Washington, D.C., and has current annual revenues of about $7 million, Eltrax said.
